title: Cafe Bombon
short: Perfect layers make this drink pretty nice to look at and it tastes even better.
descript: Sweet condensed milk and strong black coffee meet together and form a delicious treat. This is a very common drink in Spanish cafes and is the perfect small size for any afternoon treat. It will leave you feeling like you are in a cafe in Madrid.
recipe: In small glass, pour 1/4 cup of sweet condensed milk. Add 1 shot of espresso on top.

title: Affogato
short: When ice cream meets espresso, they have an affogato baby.
descript: This sweet Italian treat is made with espresso poured over a scoop of vanilla ice cream. So for those looking for best of both worlds you are in for a delight. When in Rome….or dreaming of being in Rome.
recipe: Add 2 scoops of vanilla ice cream to a glass. Pour over 1 shot espresso. Serve immediately.

title: Iced Ube Latte
short: This beautiful coloured purple drink is exactly what you need for a cold summer day.
descript: When you think yams are just meant for dinner, ube is a purple yam and is so tasty in coffee. This drink is very popular in Philippines as the sweetness of the yam and bitterness of the coffee come together with milk.
recipe: Pour 1/4 cup of milk into a tall glass. Stir in 2 teaspoons of ube extract and 1 tablespoon sweetened condensed milk. Add 2 shots of espresso and fill glass with ice.

title: Pumpkin Spice Latte
short: It’s that special time of year. The one you’ve been waiting for. No, not your birthday weekend. It’s Pumpkin spice latte time.
descript: Some times all you need to feel extra cozy is that pumpkin spice latte. Ok throw in a cozy sweater and reading socks. All the fall spices come together for this coffee which will bring you that warm fall feeling in no time.
recipe: Combine 1 cup of milk, 2 tablespoon pumpkin puree, 1 tablespoon sugar, 1/4 pumpkin pie spice and 1/4 pure vanilla extract in a pot. Whisk until hot and creamy. Add 1/4 cup espresso to a mug and pour the milk mixture on top. Top with whipped cream and nutmeg.

title: Cortado
short: The best things come in small packages. This small or “short” coffee may be the one for you.
descript: Churros with Chocolate or Churros with a Cortado. This easy recipe only requires two easy ingredients: steamed milk and espresso and will take you back to the cafes in Spain.
recipe: Pour 1/2 cup of espresso (2 shots) in a glass. Add 1/2 cup steamed milk.

title: Gingerbread Latte
short: Snow on the ground, cold temperatures. Let’s just say it happened when the gingerbread man met some milk and coffee.
descript: It’s the most wonderful time of the year. Warm up with this cozy, holiday favourite  filled with sweet cinnamon, nutmeg and ginger all mixed into one. It just may take you back to childhood making that cute gingerbread house.
recipe: In a bowl, mix together 2 teaspoons ground ginger, 1/2 teaspoon cinnamon and 1/4 ground nutmeg. In another bowl mix 2 tablespoons brown sugar and 1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract. Heat 1/2 cup of milk with all of the spices. Add in the sugar and vanilla, whisking until the sugar has dissolved. Add remaining 1/2 cup milk and keep stirring until hot. In a mug, add 1 or 2 shots espresso depending on preference to the milk mixture. Top off with whipped cream and garnish with nutmeg.

title: Dalgona
short: This whipped viral coffee drink is everything and more.
descript: If you are looking for an extra creamy and whipped dessert, get out that whisk and start whisking like you have never whisked before. This popular drink first made its appearance and went viral due to that beautiful whip.
recipe: Combine 2 tablespoons granulated sugar, 2 tablespoons instant coffee and 2 tablespoons cold water in a bowl and use a whisk or hand mixer to blend the mix until thick (up to 10 minutes with a whisk) Fill a glass with milk and then put the coffee mixture on top.

title: Frappe
short: Your favourite childhood milkshake taken to the next level.
descript: This drink will take you back to the Greek islands or to any outside patio. It’s creamy and milkshake texture is perfect for any hot summer day. Escape into this frothy delight.
recipe: Combine 2 teaspoons instant coffee, 2 teaspoons granulated sugar and 2/3 cup cold water into a shaker and shake until you have a thick foam. If you prefer a milk frother stick, place everything into a large glass and froth until foamy. Pour ice cubes into a tall glass, then add the coffee mixture and add some milk on top to fill up glass.

title: Turk Kahvesi
short: When you want to take your regular ground coffee to the next level.
descript: This drink is mainly enjoyed in the Middle East and requires a cezve (long brass pot made from copper or brass and extra fine ground coffee). If you are looking for coffee tradition, this drink is sure to be what you need.
recipe: Place water into the cezve and add sugar. Blend and bring to a boil. Remove from heat and add 1 teaspoon of coffee per cup. Boil the coffee. Allow remaining powder to settle before serving.  You can add a tablespoon of cold water to the pot after boiling twice to accelerate the process.

title: Cappuccino
short: Creamy, foamy and delicious, this long loved coffee is one of the most popular of all time.
descript: Anyone and everyone loves this classic coffee and is one of the most popular coffee types for its simplicity. You are probably from another planet if you haven’t heard of this drink as its classic nature is the basis of coffee 101. It is enjoyed all over the world.
recipe: Steam 1/2 cup milk and pour over 1/3 cup espresso. Froth 1/4 cup of milk and add to the top

title: Candy Cane Latte
short: This latte is sure to bring you back to your childhood.
descript: Candy cane or peppermint is one of the most popular holiday treats and can be found in many desserts and beverages. One popular drink is the candy cane latte as you bring back memories of your childhood with a coffee twist.
recipe: Pour 2 shots of espresso into a mug. Warm up 3/4 cup milk and add 1 tablespoon of peppermint syrup. Pour over the espresso. Top it off with whipped cream and crushed candy cane.

title: Iced Caramel Macchiato
short: Who ever said there is a limit to how much caramel you put inside, obviously never tried this drink.
descript: When you are craving a sweet drink, this iced macchiato is a very popular drink because it is pretty nice to look at. It is unique as the caramel sits at the top and the espresso is added after the milk not before to make sure it stays put on the top and move itself down. Who said drizzling wasn’t a talent.
recipe: Place 1 tablespoon of vanilla syrup into a large glass. Add 3/4 cup milk and fill glass with ice cubes. Add 2 shots of espresso and top of with caramel drizzle.

title: Mazagran
short: Quench your thirst with this cold, citrusy coffee drink
descript: Some have described this sweet drink as the original iced coffee. However it’s not the typical type we think of when we think of iced coffee. If you like lemonade and coffee, then why not combine them together.
recipe: Add one shot of espresso to a glass and mix in 1 tablespoon sugar or honey. Fill a tall glass with ice cubes. Add the espresso mixture to the glass and squeeze half a lemon (1 tablespoon of juice). Add more lemon if you like more citrus flavour.

title: Cafe Carajillo
short: Live it up by adding some liquor to your brew.
descript: Popular in Spain or Mexico, this coffee drink just needs espresso, liquor, and can be made hot or cold. Typical liquor can be used such as Brandy, Licor 43 or Rum.
recipe: Make one shot of espresso and add to a small clear glass. Add a small amount of liquor and sugar or sweetener. If desired add some cinnamon powder on top.

title: Einspanner
short: When whipped cream meets espresso, this sweet beauty is the outcome.
descript: In Vienna, this drink is popular and is a delicious way to enjoy a warm espresso with an added touch. It is very easy to prepare and can fill any craving you have for coffee and cream. The cream should float at the top to have distinct layers.
recipe: Add 2 shots of espresso to a clear glass mug. Add desired amount of sugar. In a bowl, whip 1/4 cup heavy cream until you get stiff peaks. Add the whipped cream to the glass and garnish with chocolate powder.

title: Espresso Freddo
short: Show off those shaking skills and make this popular cold drink.
descript: They say that looks can be deceiving and that is true for this drink as what may appear to be milk foam is actually just espresso shaken. So shake like you never shook before if you want to try this unique cold drink perfect for those summer days.
recipe: Brew 2 espresso shots and place in cocktail mixer or mason jar with lid that is filled with 1 cup of ice. Shake until coffee foams and strain into tall glass filled with ice.

title: Apple Pie Latte
short: Just when you thought that America’s favourite pie couldn’t be made into a latte, think again
descript: Apple pie is one of the most popular desserts around fall as it reminds us of changing weather, the beautiful leaves and smells of cinnamon in the air. The sweet flavour of apple, mixed with cinnamon, spices and brown butter come together with milk and espresso. Is it too much to have an apple pie latte with a slice of apple pie?
recipe: Pour 2 shots of espresso ( or 1/2 cup brewed coffee) to a mug. In a pot, warm 3/4 cup of milk and add in 1 tablespoon (2 pumps) of apple syrup. Add in 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon, 1 teaspoon brown butter syrup and 1 tablespoon granulated sugar. Add milk mixture to espresso. Top off with whipped cream and ground cinnamon or apple pie spice.

title: Egg Nog Latte
short: Creamy and sweet, it’s a holiday delightful treat.
descript: No holiday is complete until you have made this creamy, smooth traditional drink. Egg nog is made with a combination of eggs, milk and sugar. It is typically made in a large punch bowl and is consumed at many holiday gatherings. When you want a holiday in a cup, this drink is sure to please.
recipe: Heat up 1/2 cup prepared Egg nog in a milk pot. Add 1/2 cup milk. Remove from heat and froth. Pour 2 shots or 1/4 cup of espresso into a mug and top with 1/2 cup of the egg nog milk mixture. Add whipped cream and nutmeg.

title: Red Velvet Latte
short: Cafe mocha’s cousin, this coffee combines that beautiful red color with intense mocha flavours.
descript: February 14th, the day of love, the day of Saint Valentine. Whether it’s Valentine Day or Galentine Day, this drink is for you. We typically associate this day to red velvet treats. Why stop at red velvet cake or cupcake? This creamy twist on mocha is the perfect coffee for that special day with that special someone.
recipe: Heat 1 cup of milk with 1/4 cup semi-sweet chocolate chips. Add in 1 tablespoon vanilla extract and 1 tablespoon granulated sugar. Continue to stir until all the chips are melted but make sure not to boil. Add in 1 o 2 drops of red food colouring. You can also use 1 tablespoon of beetroot powder if you prefer more than the food colouring. Brew 1/4 cup of coffee of your choice. Add to mug and then pour the milk mixture. Finish off with whipped cream and red sprinkles or chocolate powder.

title: Hot Cross Bun Latte
short: Most people are either team hot cross bun or not. But everyone may be team hot cross bun latte.
descript: Hot Cross Buns, Hot Cross latte, one a penny, two a penny hot cross buns. When it is Easter time, the hot cross buns typically with currants or raisins, come out to be enjoyed. Delicious spices and some fruity flavours makes this coffee a special treat to enjoy.
recipe: In a small bowl, mix together 1 tablespoon all spice, 1 teaspoon nutmeg and 1 teaspoon cinnamon. Set aside. Pour 1/2 cup milk into a pot and on low heat add in the spices. Add in 1 slice dried orange peel and keep stirring for 1 minute. Remove from heat and remove the dried orange peel. Brew 2 shots espresso and add to a mug. Pour the milk mixture on top and add in sugar as desired. Top off with some whipped cream and nutmeg or cinnamon.

title: Espresso Con Panna
short: When all you have is espresso and whipped cream, be creative and try this.
descript: You don’t have to be sitting under the Tuscan sun for this one. This is one of the most simple coffee treats as it only contains two ingredients. Add a sweet touch to any espresso and enjoy.
recipe: Add two shots of espresso to a glass cup. Top off with whipped cream.

title: Hojicha Iced Latte
short: Sometimes when you want to escape that traditional coffee, this iced drink is exactly what you didn’t know you were looking for.
descript: Hojicha is type of green tea which has a smoky and nutty flavour. It is similar to matcha green tea but does not have caffeine. When you want to have a nutty creamy iced latte, this drink will be a perfect fit.
recipe: Steep 2 Hojicha tea bags and let it cool. Add ice to a tall glass and add in 1/2 cup milk along with the cooled hojicha tea. You can also pour 1 teaspoon Hojicha powder into 1/2 cup boiled water. Once cooled, add the ice and milk.

title: Yuenyeung
short: When coffee and milk get together, this sweet drink will be sure to satisfy any craving.
descript: Coffee? Tea? Sometimes you just can’t decide and want a bit of both worlds. This drink is perfect as it satisfies both of the cravings you may have. It is smooth and has just enough sweetness.
recipe: In a pot, add 1 cup of milk with 1 black tea bag and 2 tablespoons of granulated sugar. Keep stirring until the sugar is dissolved and milk is steaming. Remove the tea bag. Brew one cup of coffee and add the milk tea mixture to the coffee.

title: Egg Nog Latte
short: Creamy and sweet, this is a go to delightful holiday treat.
descript: No holiday is complete until you have made this creamy, smooth traditional drink. Egg nog is made with a combination of eggs, milk and sugar. It is definitely a holiday in a cup. Coffee makes everything better.
recipe: Heat up 1/2 cup prepared Egg nog in a milk pot. Add 1/2 cup milk. Remove from heat and froth. Pour 2 shots or 1/4 cup of espresso into a mug and top with 1/2 cup of the egg nog milk mixture. Add whipped cream and nutmeg.

title: Americano Misto
short: All time favourite espresso based beverage.
descript: For all the espresso lovers out there this one is for you. Espresso shots plus equal shots of hot water get layered in this drink and combined with steamed milk. It’s creamy, its rich and its a must try.
recipe: Brew 2 shots of espresso and add to a cup or mug. Place 1/2 cup of milk into a pot or steam the 1/2 cup of milk. Place equal parts of hot water on top of the espresso then add your milk.

title: Macchiato
short: When you want that caffeine fix, this is the right one for you.
descript: If you crave espresso and not much more this drink has its eyes on you. Macchiato sounds fancy when all it means is “stained”. In the coffee world this means espresso with a drop of frothed milk.
recipe: Make 1/4 cup of espresso and place into an espresso cup. Froth 1/4 cup of milk until foamy. Spoon milk foam on top of espresso.

title: Cappuccino Freddo
short: Who says the cappuccino is best served hot? Take your cappuccino to the next level.
descript: Add two shots of espresso to a cup. Fill a cocktail shaker or mason jar with ice. Add the espresso to the shaker or jar and shake. Pour the espresso and ice into a drinking glass. Add 1/2 cup milk to a cocktail shaker or mason jar with lid. Shake until you get a nice frothy foam. Add milk to the espresso and enjoy. Optional -you can add some sugar if you like a sweeter drink.

title: Nous Nous
short: Take time out of your day to enjoy this.
descript: Nous Nous means half half so all you really need to enjoy this is milk and espresso. The espresso itself tends to be strong but it is the perfect drink for someone looking to explore Morrocan culture. Order nous nous instead of capuccino and you will get this local delight.
recipe: Warm up 1/2 cup of milk and use a frother wand to froth up the milk. Next prepare 2 shots of espresso. Place the frothed milk into a cup and then add the espresso.

title: Pharisäer Kaffee
short: When you feel like something unique, this coffee drink with rum may be just what you need.
descript: This German coffee goes back in time to adding a little bit of rum and whipped cream to the coffee. Rum makes everything take better right? Traditionally served in a tumbler glass.
recipe: Add one sugar cube to a warmed up cup. Fill it 3/4 to the top with coffee and add in 1 shot of heated up rum. Placed 1/2 cup of heavy whipping cream on top and garnish with chocolate powder.

title: Eiskaffee
short: Cold coffee and vanilla ice cream make for the perfect drink for any summer day.
descript: When you want dessert in a cup, you may want to try this creamy traditional German drink. It’s not your grandma’s iced coffee.
recipe: Mix together 1 cup brewed coffee with 1/4 cup evaporated milk and 1 teaspoon sugar. Chill for 30 minutes. Place 2 scoops of vanilla ice cream in a tall glass. Pour the chilled mixture over the ice cream and top off with whipped cream.

title: Kaffeost
short: If you want to add a coffee to your bucket list, this unique beverage may be the one.
descript: If you look down and saw that there were chunks of cheese in your coffee, you may think someone is pulling a prank on you, but actually this is a delicious treat in Finland and Sweden. If you are in the mood to try something completely out of your comfort zone, this coffee may be for you.
recipe: Depending on the country you are in, the bread cheese (juustoleipä or leipäjuusto) needed for this drink may be hard to find. If you are able to get some, cut small pieces of the cheese into a hot cup of coffee. For extra authenticity, try a wooden mug.

title: Einspänner
short: When whipped cream meets espresso, this sweet beauty is the outcome.
descript: In Vienna, this drink is popular and is a delicious way to enjoy a warm espresso with an added touch. It is very easy to prepare and can fill any craving you have for coffee and cream. The cream should float at the top to have distinct layers.
recipe: Add 2 shots of espresso to a clear glass mug. Add desired amount of sugar. In a bowl, whip 1/4 cup heavy cream until you get stiff peaks. Add the whipped cream to the glass and garnish with chocolate powder.
